emerging_technologies.name: AI-Powered Autonomous Software Development
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that can autonomously develop, test, and deploy software from high-level requirements, reducing human involvement in coding.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces the need for human programmers, potential for job displacement, but also opens up new types of jobs in AI training and management.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires advancements in AI reliability and ethical considerations around autonomous decision-making in software creation.

emerging_technologies.name: Brain-Computer Interfaces for Daily Use
emerging_technologies.description: Non-invasive brain-computer interfaces that enable control of digital devices through thought for widespread consumer use.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Improves quality of life for disabled individuals, raises privacy concerns regarding mental data, and ethical issues about brain control.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Public acceptance of brain data privacy, cost reduction, and technological miniaturization.

emerging_technologies.name: Space-based Solar Power Satellites
emerging_technologies.description: Satellites capturing solar energy in space and beaming it back to Earth for consumption, providing constant, clean energy.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for unlimited clean energy, geopolitical implications of space resource control, environmental considerations for space debris.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological advancements in energy transmission, international space law, and investment in space infrastructure.

emerging_technologies.name: Blockchain-Enhanced Privacy Protocols
emerging_technologies.description: Utilization of blockchain for enhancing privacy through decentralized identity verification and data management.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Increases individual control over personal data, complicates regulatory oversight, and potential for reducing identity theft.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Scalability issues of blockchain, regulatory acceptance, and integration with existing systems.

mainstream_technologies.name: Full-Stack AI Development Tools
mainstream_technologies.description: AI tools that assist in all phases of software development, from code writing to deployment and maintenance.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted by software companies for efficiency and cost reduction, becoming standard in developer toolkits.

mainstream_technologies.name: Smart Autonomous Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Vehicles capable of navigating without human intervention in most scenarios, integrated with smart cities infrastructure.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Increasingly common in urban areas, with regulatory frameworks in place for safety and liability.

epoch_themes.description: The era focuses on the progression towards systems that operate autonomously, reducing human involvement in routine tasks.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Shift in labor markets, ethical considerations of autonomous decision-making, and new forms of human-AI collaboration.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased automation in industries, policy development for autonomous systems, and a push towards sustainable practices.

epoch_themes.description: Technological advancements aimed at environmental sustainability and resource management.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Global effort towards reducing carbon footprint, creating new markets for green technology, and addressing climate change.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Renewable energy adoption, international cooperation on environmental issues, and innovation in material science.

epoch_themes.description: Enhancing privacy, security, and personal data control through advanced digital infrastructure.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Empowerment of individuals in data governance, potential for reducing cybercrime, and new challenges in cybersecurity.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Legislative movements towards digital rights, development of privacy-centric technologies, and increasing public awareness of data rights.
